org.jacp.javafx.rcp.componentLayout

Class PerspectiveLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacp.javafx.rcp.util.Checkable
      • org.jacp.javafx.rcp.componentLayout.PerspectiveLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPerspectiveLayout<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.scene.Node>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FXMLPerspectiveLayout, FXPerspectiveLayout

    public abstract class PerspectiveLayout
extends Checkable
implements IPerspectiveLayout<javafx.scene.Node,javafx.scene.Node>
    The basic perspective layout to set the root and the child nodes of a perspective. Use registerChildNodes to define and register containers where subcomponents can be added.
    Author:
    Andy Moncsek

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PerspectiveLayout() 
      PerspectiveLayout(javafx.scene.Node rootComponent) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javafx.scene.Node getRootComponent()
      Get the ' layoutwrapper' for perspective; a layout component is a component which can contain UI subcomponents.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,javafx.scene.Node> getTargetLayoutComponents()
      Returns map of target components and ids key - id value - target component.
      void registerTargetLayoutComponent(java.lang.String id, javafx.scene.Node target)
      Register a target component; a target component defines a wrapper where editors and views can "live" in; you can define a target for each editor or view component; create an root component, a complex layout an register all components where editors/views should displayed in.
